result.execSummary:
The defendant Kodi C. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Comply with conditions as stated in 21CF-334.
-Payment of all court ordered obligations and supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

10:40 AM Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Kodi C. Olson.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 21CF-334, 21CF-407 and 22CF-16.

Court calls cases.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matters are set for a sentencing hearing.
Parties state that there is no reason why the Court cannot proceed.
Neither party has testimony or evidence to present.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
No victims wish to address the Court.
Zoom is up right now.
Agent Haese Whitman is present by Zoom, if there are any questions.

No victim impact statement was provided in any of the cases.
Atty Renc has seen the restitution summary.

Parties are prepared to go forward to argument and sentencing.
State has received a copy of the presentence investigation (PSI), has no corrections to be made.
Atty Renc has received a copy of the PSI, makes an addition on page 24.

Atty Dodge addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
10:55 AM Court will take a break.
11:00 AM Court is back in session.
Atty Dodge continues with the sentence recommendations.
Court took a short break as Defendant was having physical issues.
Atty Renc states that her client is good and ready to proceed.

Atty Renc addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. 
973.017

BY THE COURT:
21CF-334:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 5.5 years.
Initial Confinement for 2.5 years.
Extended Supervision for 36 months.
5 days credit against initial confinement.
Eligible for challenge incarceration program.
Eligible for substance abuse program.
Conditions:
No contact with K.R.O., unless it involves custody of their children.
No violent or abusive contact with J.O., Jr.
Absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. 
Consume prescription medication in the manner and dosage prescribed.
Obtain a mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations including counseling and taking medications as prescribed.
Successfully complete a CGIP Assessment and follow through with any and all treatment recommendations.
Successfully complete an Anger Management Assessment and follow through with any and all treatment recommendations.
Successfully comply with Portage County Health and Human Services for reunification with your children.
Complete parenting classes.
Maintain full time employment or actively seek full time employment as outlined by department of corrections. 
Complete programming as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.
Payment of all court ordered obligations and supervision fees.
Provide DNA Sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Pay restitution in the amount as listed, $461.33, in case 334.


21CF-334:
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for 1 year.
Concurrent to Count 1. 
Conditions:
Comply with conditions in Count 1. 
Payment of all court ordered obligations and supervision fees.
Provide DNA Sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge.


21CF-407:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for 1 year.
Consecutive to 21CF-334 and 22CF-16.
55 days credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions in 21CF-334.
Payment of all court ordered obligations and supervision fees.
Provide DNA Sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge.


22CF-16:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 5.5 years.
Initial Confinement for 2.5 years.
Extended Supervision for 36 months.
1 day credit.
Eligible for challenge incarceration program.
Eligible for substance abuse program.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 21CF-334.
Payment of all court ordered obligations and supervision fees.
Provide DNA Sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge.


Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge on applicable charge.

Atty Renc requests a stay of execution within 30 days.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the request for a stay. 

Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Portage County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Kodi C. Olson.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are: 21CF334, 21CF-407, 21CF-444, 21CM-304, 22CF-16, 22CF-96, 22CF-97, 21TR-2768, and 21TR-2769. 

3:08 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

This matter is set for a plea hearing today.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Plea offer sheet has been handed out.
21CF-334: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3. Count 2 and Count 4 and Count 5 will be dismissed and read in.
21CF-407: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4 will be dismissed and read in.
21CM-304: Case is dismissed and read in.
21CF-444: Case is dismissed and read in.
22CF-16: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
22CF-96: Case is dismissed and read in.
22CF-97: State moves to dismiss this case outright.
21TR-2768 and 2769: State moves to dismiss cases.

Court questions Atty Dodge regarding the basis for the outright dismissal of 22CF-97.
Parties will be requesting a presentence investigation.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF-334: Count 1: No Contest.
21CF-334: Count 3: No Contest.
21CF-407: Count 2: No Contest.
22CF-16: Count 1:No Contest. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of  21CF-334: Count 1 and Count 3, 21CF-407: Count 2 and 22CF-16: Count 1. 
Domestic abuse charges are clarified. 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
21CF-334: Count 2 and Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and read in.
21CF-407: Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4: Dismissed and read in.
21CM-304: Dismissed and read in.
21CF-444: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-16: Count 2: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-96: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-97: Dismissed outright.
21TR-2768: Dismissed.
21TR-2769: Dismissed.

State has complied with victim rights.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a presentence investigation be produced. 
Presentence be done and filed no later than close of business on August 19th.
If either party has alternative sentencing documents or supporting letters, to be filed by August 26th.
Bond is continued.

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
